Description: Rim and body sherd of Attic black-figured pottery Siana cup; interior glazed black; exterior: on rim, ivy wreath with alternate added red and black leaves and central dilute stem; band at join with handle zone; in handle zone black-figure decoration consisting of deer grazing to left (head, neck and right foreleg missing; red spot and four dots in faded colour on rump; trace of red on remaining part of neck); below, band and glazed lower wall.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Ashmolean Museum, Oxford. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Bibliographic references: Venit 1982 / Painted Pottery from the Greek Mainland found in Egypt, 640-450 BC (p. 376, no. B519)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GA.0372) (Phase 1)
Previous owner: Currently owned by: Ashmolean Museum, University of Oxford
